forms.name: Symphony
forms.description: A large-scale orchestral work, typically in four movements, representing the pinnacle of orchestral composition.

keyWorks.why: The archetypal symphony—from struggle to triumph
Perfect Classical balance with Romantic intensity
Masterful synthesis of form and emotion

listenFor: The development of themes across movements
Contrast between movement characters
The orchestra working as one unified instrument

forms.name: Concerto
forms.description: A work featuring a solo instrument (or group) in dialogue with an orchestra, showcasing virtuosity and interplay.

keyWorks.why: Grand Romantic virtuosity at its finest
Seamless fusion of soloist and orchestra

listenFor: The conversation between soloist and orchestra
The cadenza—the soloist's virtuosic showcase
How the soloist leads or responds to the orchestra

forms.name: Sonata
forms.description: A multi-movement work for solo piano or piano with one other instrument, exploring the full range of the instrument(s).

keyWorks.why: Classical elegance with a famous finale

listenFor: Sonata form's exposition, development, and recapitulation
The relationship between themes
How the instrument's full capabilities are explored

forms.name: Fugue
forms.description: A complex composition where a theme (subject) is introduced and then imitated by multiple voices in counterpoint.

structure.description: Subject introduced in each voice in turn
Return to home key, often with stretto

keyWorks.why: 48 fugues in all 24 keys—the Bible of fugue
The ultimate exploration of fugal technique

listenFor: The subject's first entry and subsequent imitations
How voices weave around each other
The building complexity as more voices join

forms.name: Opera
forms.description: A dramatic work combining music, singing, and theatrical staging to tell a story.

keyWorks.why: Perfect fusion of comedy and human truth

listenFor: How music reflects character emotions
The contrast between recitative and aria
The orchestra's role in creating atmosphere

forms.name: String Quartet
forms.description: Music for two violins, viola, and cello—four equal voices in intimate conversation.
listenFor: Four distinct voices conversing as equals
No place to hide—every note matters
The interplay and handoffs between instruments

forms.name: Ballet
forms.description: Music composed for dance performance, often telling a story through purely orchestral means.

structure.description: Collection of dances forming the work

listenFor: How music suggests movement and gesture
Character themes and their transformations
The drama told purely through sound

forms.name: Prelude
forms.description: Originally an introductory piece, later a standalone short composition capturing a single mood or idea.
listenFor: The single mood or atmosphere created
How much expression fits in small space
Technical challenges disguised as music

forms.name: Nocturne
forms.description: A dreamy, lyrical piano piece evoking the night, characterized by singing melodies over arpeggiated accompaniment.
listenFor: The 'singing' right-hand melody
The flowing left-hand accompaniment
Expressive ornamentation and rubato

forms.name: Requiem
forms.description: A musical setting of the Mass for the Dead, combining profound spiritual texts with powerful music.
listenFor: The Dies Irae's terrifying drama
Contrast between wrath and peace
How each composer interprets mortality

forms.name: Theme and Variations
forms.description: A theme is presented, then transformed through successive variations that alter melody, harmony, rhythm, or character.

structure.description: Often culminating variation or return to theme

keyWorks.work: Variations on a Theme by Haydn

listenFor: The original theme that everything grows from
How each variation transforms the theme
The unity beneath the diversity

forms.name: Tone Poem / Symphonic Poem
forms.description: A single-movement orchestral work that tells a story, depicts a scene, or illustrates an idea.

keyWorks.why: A river's journey through Czech landscape
Impressionist dream of a mythological afternoon

listenFor: How music 'paints' the programmatic story
Leitmotifs representing characters or ideas
The narrative arc through sound alone
